chargeHist.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keanu Monte Ferguson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Keanu Monte Ferguson.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Fedel.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Attorney Golden is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Keanu Monte Ferguson.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned.  Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Correspondence dated August 30, 2022 from the Public Defender's Office regarding appoint of counsel; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson not in court, in custody at MSDF.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in court by video, in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminray hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Keanu Monte Ferguson in custody at MSDF.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keanu Monte Ferguson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
